text: yo my needle drops Anthony Fantino here
the Internet's busiest music nerd gonna
do an album review for you the drums
self-titled before I get started I want
to tell you guys that if you click the
link up there see that link says the
needle drop has my name up there if you
click on that it'll bring you to my main
channel page if you scroll down on there
there are an entire there is an entire
list of different music reviewers on
YouTube check those guys out if you like
what they do give them a sub and if you
sub tell them the needle drop Sencha and
that's it
music reviewer community alright the
drums are a New York outfit and I've
been listening to so much New York music
that my ears are going to rot off but no
saint that bad these guys have been
building a lot of buzz since 2009 on
really thin jangly drum machine pop with
very reverb Laden vocals in 2009 they
released the summertime EP and that
thing had songs like let's go surfin
spreading across the music blogosphere
like the herp and I wasn't the biggest
fan of that ep
to be quite honest didn't really see
what the buzz was about behind the whole
thing though I did like a few tracks off
of it and because I wasn't totally in
love with that thing I was kind of
surprised to find it tracks from that EP
made the cut on to the new album
thankfully there were songs off the EP
that I liked and they do sound slightly
remixed in some cases on this new album
and what can you expect if you listen to
this thing well for one simplicity some
of these tracks are so stripped down so
skeletal so bare-bones that they make
wires pink flag look like an orchestra
suite there's a real lack of warmth and
low-end throughout this entire album and
it's no wonder no bass guitar also the
drum machine sounds so tinny it puts the
word tin into tinnitus I'm awful I'm
awful however that sonic hollowness is
more than made up for with
strong as hell hooks they give these
songs a real first listen memorability
with lots of pretty melodies and steady
beats that are really worth swaying your
shoulders to plus I'm really no stranger
to the type of sound that you're going
to find on this LP it's nothing that
hasn't been done before by groups like
the Smiths Joy Division or even new
order when they were making stuff around
the time of low life also the Cure also
surf rock a little bit
I guess my gripes about the album the
double guitar the drums and the vocal
combination don't exactly add up to a
lot of variation there's quite a bit of
sonic sameness on this album however I'd
say the hooks are good enough to be able
to pull one song apart from the other
but still if you're looking for a
significant change past the one or two
tracks that you may have already heard
from this album yeah that's not going to
happen also I can see this turning other
people off so I'm going to warn you
however it really didn't bug me didn't
bug me at all but there is an extremely
persistent whine enos on the vocals of
this album a lot of just cracked vocals
some flat notes and just really some
however I really find the emotion that
Jonathan Pierce frontman Jonathan Pierce
brings to these songs really just
captivating really just makes you know
the flat notes all that other stuff for
me just kind of irrelevant if you're
kind of a vocal purist if you really
like your vocals on key you like them
concise this may not be the release for
you but if you're looking for something
that is more emotional than it is on key
something bright light and summery
something that's going to make new order
Joy Division and the Smiths fans warm
where it counts painfully emotional and
about as straightforward as a punch to
the face it's extreme pop simplicity
it's the drums self-titled full-length
you should really be putting your ears
on that score but that's pretty much
just how I'm feeling let me know what
you guys think of this do you love this
thing do you hate it and why
and also favorite this video and make
YouTube a better place
Anthony Fantana the drums forever
